message: If I change the type of a field (e.g. from IntegerField to BooleanField), south may break.  Currently, I simply prepend an underscore to the field, do the migration, which removes the field, remove the underscore and do another migration.

I think that is a good approach. I generally recommend mapping schema changes to the most granular migration steps possible. From experience, it reduces a lot of stress. In this case, we can say that the logical operation of changing a field type is really 2 table operations - removing a column and then adding one that happens to have the same name.
